title: Commutative Property of Addition
text: The equation can be re-arranged in the form $$L+L+W+W$$
speech: The equation can be re-arranged in the form    l plus   l plus   w plus   w
pacedSpeech: The equation can be re-arranged in the form     l plus   l plus   w plus   w

title: Simplify
speech: l plus   l plus   w plus   w is equal to, 2   l, plus 2   w
pacedSpeech: l plus   l plus   w plus   w is equal to, 2   l, plus 2   w

title: Common Multiple
text: Both 2L and 2W have $$2$$ as a common multiple.
speech: Both 2L and 2W have  2  as a common multiple.

title: Common Multiple
text: You can take a common factor of $$2$$ outside the equation to get $$2\left(L+W\right)$$
speech: You can take a common factor of  2  outside the equation to get  2 times, parentheses,   l plus   w,
pacedSpeech: You can take a common factor of   2
outside the equation to get   2 times, ,   l plus   w,
